snippet: As Russian officials on Wednesday retrieved a 1,250-pound fragment of a meteor that exploded last February over Chelyabinsk, the rock broke — and broke a scale.
abstract: Russian officials retrieve the largest fragment so far of a meteor that exploded in Feb 2013 over city of Chelyabinsk, but as divers and a mechanical winch lift it from the bottom of a lake, rock breaks into three pieces, and then breaks the scale, literally, when all together it weighs in at more than 1,250 pounds.
lead_paragraph: As Russian officials on Wednesday retrieved a 1,250-pound fragment of a meteor that exploded last February over Chelyabinsk, the rock broke — and broke a scale.

headline.main: Lifted From a Russian Lake, a Big, if Fragile, Space Rock
headline.print_headline: Lifted From a Russian Lake, A Big, if Fragile, Space Rock
